channel.title: Help with richscape compiler
channel.description:
ok heres what i put:
[code] @echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code]
and this is what it says:
[code]javac: file not found: *java useage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options finished! press any key to continue[/code]
can anyone help me? or tell me a compiler that goes with richscape?

item.title: Help with richscape compiler
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

Go into your program files, go in java, go in jdk, go in the bin, then find the file that’s called “java” then copy and paste it into your source folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with richscape compiler
item.dc:creator: @legend_the_hero legend the hero
item.description:
@legend_the_hero wrote:

ugh. I don’t know the variables but i have the latest java.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with richscape compiler
item.dc:creator: @verak verak
item.description:
@verak wrote:

Use any compiler… RichScape dosent have a specific complier, Maybe get newest JDk/Edit ur batch file to ur current JDK.

Read full topic

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed.
